summary:
• Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi may secure his third term in office according to recent polls.
• The outcome is uncertain as predictions vary among different surveys.
• Final results will be determined by voter turnout on election day.

• Robert Pickton died on February 12, 2021.
• He was found guilty of murdering six women in British Columbia.
• His farm became known as "ground zero" for the serial killings.

• China is planning to send a spacecraft to attempt a historic landing on the far side of the Moon.
• This mission marks a significant milestone in China's lunar exploration program.
• The successful completion of this feat would make China one of only three countries to have achieved such a feat after the Soviet Union and the United States.

• Estonia has no contingency plan in place if Ukraine were to fall to Russian forces.
• The country is concerned about the potential implications of a Ukrainian collapse on regional security.
• Estonia's lack of a backup plan highlights its vulnerability to Russian aggression.

• The rise of a young French leader is expected to impact EU politics.
• The upcoming EU elections may affect Belgium's future existence as a country.
• These factors will influence European politics in the coming years.

• An anti-Islam activist was stabbed.
• The incident involved six people being wounded.
• It occurred in Germany.

• A powerful volcanic eruption in Iceland has created mesmerizing lava rivers.
• The intense heat from the eruption is melting snow and ice around it.
• The unique display is attracting tourists to witness the rare natural phenomenon.

• Polls predict that India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi may secure his third term in office.
• The ongoing elections have been marred by arrests, allegations, and controversies involving technology like Artificial Intelligence.
• Electoral irregularities and concerns about transparency have arisen during the voting process.
• Despite these challenges, India is set to host the largest democratic exercise globally.
• Reports indicate instances of electoral malpractices and manipulation during the voting period.
• The country grapples with severe heatwave conditions, resulting in deaths and water scarcity issues.

• Israel will only agree to a ceasefire in Gaza if its objectives are met, according to PM Netanyahu.
• Pressure mounts on Netanyahu to secure a ceasefire deal for Gaza.
• Israel has withdrawn troops from Jabalya, leaving behind devastating damage.

• A former gay man shares his experience with harmful "conversion therapy" in Italy.
• Venice introduces new rules to reduce tourism impact on the city.
• The same individual describes their "darkest period" during the time they underwent conversion therapy.

• The Mexican government has announced that the presidential election will take place on June 6th.
• The main contenders include Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, Enrique Peña Nieto, and Josefina Vazquez Mota.
• The election is expected to have a significant impact on Mexico's economy, security, and social policies.

• South Africa's ANC is set to form a coalition government due to its reduced majority.
• The exact date for announcing the South African election results remains unknown.
• The ANC is likely to lose its majority in parliament for the first time.

• North Korea has been accused of sending more propaganda balloons carrying anti-South messages and leaflets across the demilitarized zone.
• The balloons, which have reportedly caused no damage or casualties, have sparked concerns about escalating tensions between the two nations.
• This is not an isolated incident; similar balloon launches have occurred in recent years as part of ongoing efforts to provoke and intimidate South Korea.

• Biden announces that Ukraine can use US weapons for limited strikes in Russia
• This decision marks an escalation of military support to Ukraine in its conflict with Russia
• The move aims to deter further Russian aggression and demonstrate strong international backing for Ukraine's sovereignty

• Trump's White House bid continues despite lawyer confirming to BBC.
• Artist is unsurprised by their success as a bestseller.
• President Biden unveils ceasefire plans for Gaza conflict.

• A joint US-British airstrike killed at least 16 people in Yemen.
• The Houthis claimed responsibility for an attack on a Saudi-led coalition warship.
• No casualties were reported from the warship incident.
